result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Dunn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David R Dunn in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David R Dunn IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.

AS TO COUNT #1:  Court ORDERED the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count #2, straight time with credit for 5 days pretrial incarceraton credit.  

AS TO COUNT #2:  Court ORDERED the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count #1, straight time with credit for 0 days pretrial incarceraton credit.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 MONTHS with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO C0UNT #s 1 & 2: 
*Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* No contact with the victim, Nolanda J. or the block of 3161 N. 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI.
* Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Involvement in a job program or vocational program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Attend an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens - no possession of illegal drugs.
* Pay DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

**Court APPROVES expungement if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations.

 Appeal rights given. 

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant David R Dunn in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David R Dunn IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court AMENDS the Burglary charge to two misdemeanor charges.  Count #1 - Theft of Movable Property [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a).  Count #2 - Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.14.

AS TO COUNT #1 and COUNT #2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Attorney Vincent Guimont in court, defendant David R Dunn not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing date.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 03-10-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant David R Dunn in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant David R Dunn in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/30/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nolanda J

Defendant David R Dunn in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant David R Dunn in custody.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
